com.example.android.camera2video

Class Camera2VideoFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • com.example.android.camera2video.Camera2VideoFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v13.app.FragmentCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class Camera2VideoFragment
extends android.app.Fragment
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.support.v13.app.FragmentCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback
    I pulled this straight from Google's examples and made modifications of my own in order to tailor it for our app. It receives controls from the CameraActivity so we know when to start and stop recording video. Also sets video footage to 4K in order to have as much data as we can to analyze the drone footage and recognize the drone.
    Version:
    1.0.3
    Author:
    Jonathan Westerfield

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static Camera2VideoFragment newInstance()

      • chooseVideoSize

        private static android.util.Size chooseVideoSize(android.util.Size[] choices)
        In this sample, we choose a video size with 16x9 aspect ratio. Also, we will be trying to get the biggest size that fits our aspect ratio so we can get the highest resolution video possible. These sizes make the emulator run hella slow but hopefully a real phone will handle the load much better.
        Parameters:
        choices - The list of available sizes
        Returns:
        The video size

      • chooseOptimalSize

        private static android.util.Size chooseOptimalSize(android.util.Size[] choices,
                                                   int width,
                                                   int height,
                                                   android.util.Size aspectRatio)
        Given choices of Sizes supported by a camera, chooses the smallest one whose width and height are at least as large as the respective requested values, and whose aspect ratio matches with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        choices - The list of sizes that the camera supports for the intended output class
        width - The minimum desired width
        height - The minimum desired height
        aspectRatio - The aspect ratio
        Returns:
        The optimal Size, or an arbitrary one if none were big enough

      • configureTransform

        private void configureTransform(int viewWidth,
                                int viewHeight)
        Configures the necessary Matrix transformation to `mTextureView`. This method should not to be called until the camera preview size is determined in openCamera, or until the size of `mTextureView` is fixed.
        Parameters:
        viewWidth - The width of `mTextureView`
        viewHeight - The height of `mTextureView`

        Parameters:

        Returns:
